body: How do you work with perlin generation that elegantly? I've tweaked existing stuff before but only have a vague idea of what the variables do, and I can't create anything complex with it. How do you pick up these kinds of things when no learning resources exist (this would also be useful for other stuff)? I'm not a person that needs to take courses but I look a lot of stuff up on stack overflow; I never understood how some people "just know" how to do almost everything.
body_html: How do you work with perlin generation that elegantly? I've tweaked existing stuff before but only have a vague idea of what the variables do, and I can't create anything complex with it. How do you pick up these kinds of things when no learning resources exist (this would also be useful for other stuff)? I'm not a person that needs to take courses but I look a lot of stuff up on stack overflow; I never understood how some people "just know" how to do almost everything.

parent.body: How do you work with perlin generation that elegantly? I've tweaked existing stuff before but only have a vague idea of what the variables do, and I can't create anything complex with it. How do you pick up these kinds of things when no learning resources exist (this would also be useful for other stuff)? I'm not a person that needs to take courses but I look a lot of stuff up on stack overflow; I never understood how some people "just know" how to do almost everything.
parent.body_html: How do you work with perlin generation that elegantly? I've tweaked existing stuff before but only have a vague idea of what the variables do, and I can't create anything complex with it. How do you pick up these kinds of things when no learning resources exist (this would also be useful for other stuff)? I'm not a person that needs to take courses but I look a lot of stuff up on stack overflow; I never understood how some people "just know" how to do almost everything.
